groups.name: Things you wear on your head
Things that come in a pack

easy.notes: Easy groups: 1) items that all share a typical tail (animal theme). 2) Everyday headwear. 3) Common shapes with straight sides. 4) Things sold or used in sets. Near-miss: 'pencil', 'crayon', 'marker', 'puzzle' could be mistaken for 'kit' items, but they clearly belong to school/creative supplies here.

groups.name: Words that end with -er related to actions
Parts of a house you can touch

medium.notes: Medium groups: 1) -er words indicating people who perform actions; avoid misplacing 'runners' with other occupations. 2) Common house parts. 3) Items you can tie. 4) Foods with yellow centers or exteriors. Near-miss: 'window' could be mistaken for 'pane' concept, but 'window' better fits touchable house part.

groups.name: Instruments that make sound when blown
Things that grow from a seed but are eaten

hard.notes: Hard groups: 1) Wind instruments. 2) Seeded edible plants. 3) Rhyming with 'bright' (simple rhyme pattern). 4) Timekeeping devices. Near-miss: 'watch' could be confused with 'clock' in other groups, but each item fits best in its own category; avoid treating 'watch' as 'clock' in another group.
